business.headline: Why US reciprocal tariffs aren't spooking Dalal Street investors anymoreForeign investors are back, and markets are rallying. But with Trump's reciprocal tariffs set for April 2, will the optimism last, or is another sell-off on the way?

Sensex jumps over 700 points, rises for 6th straight day: What's driving the rallyStock Market Today: The Sensex opened at 77,456.27 and reached a high of 77,585.67 during early trade. Similarly, Nifty opened at 23,515.40 and touched a high of 23,559.90.
NCC share price jumps 5% after Rs 1,480 crore hospital redevelopment orderNCC Ltd's stock price jumped in early trade after the company secured a contract worth Rs 1,480 crore.

Defence stocks are rising again. Is BHEL a good buy after recent order wins?Having declined over 24% in the past six months and over 9% in 2025, the stock has finally started showing signs of recovery. In the past month it has gained 11% and nearly 8% in the past five trading sessions.
Sensex, Nifty gain as energy stocks rally and foreign inflows surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 579.88 points to 77,485.39, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 160.85 points to 23,511.25 as of 9:26 AM.

Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher: How to trade on Dalal Street today?Dalal Street is expected to open higher as the overall market sentiment remains positive, with traders watching key levels for further movement.

Sensex, Nifty opening prediction on March 24: What to expect from D-Street todayNifty50 posted its biggest weekly gain in over four years, driven by renewed interest from foreign investors and expectations that the recent market decline has come to an end.

Stocks to watch on March 24: RIL, Ola, Raymond, Adani Green, Mahindra & MahindraAs markets resume trading, several stocks will be in focus due to key developments. These include Reliance Industries, Mahindra & Mahindra, Ola Electric, Adani Green, Adani Enterprises, NCC, Dr. Reddy's, Max Healthcare.

Kumar Mangalam Birla wins Business Today's Business Icon of the Year awardThe award recognises not only Kumar Mangalam Birla's achievements over the past three decades since he took over the reins of his family business at the tender age of 28, but also showcases his visionary approach in changing times.

Kumar Mangalam Birla honoured with Business Icon of the Year at BT MindRushAt Business Today MindRush 2025, Aditya Birla Group Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla was honoured with the 'Business Icon of the Year' award.

What does Tesla entry mean for India's automotive industry? Nitin Gadkari answersAt the Business Today Mindrush 2025 forum, Nitin Gadkari expressed confidence that India's automotive industry would become the second largest in the world in the next few years.

India on track to become 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047, says Kumar Mangalam BirlaAditya Birla Group Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla said India is on track for Viksit Bharat 2047, crediting policy stability, infrastructure growth, and economic momentum.

entertainment.headline: 'Papa, Kattapaa': How Salman Khan introduced Sathyaraj to father Salim KhanActor Sathyaraj spoke about how Salman Khan introduced him to his father, Salim Khan, at the Sikandar trailer launch. The actor will be seen playing the antagonist in AR Murugadoss's Sikandar.

Deepika Padukone calls out Oscars for snubbing Indian films, recalls RRR momentActor Deepika Padukone expressed her disappointment over India's repeated snubs at the Oscars. She believes that Indian films and talent have been overlooked too many times by the prestigious awards.

Tamannaah defends playing Shiva Shakti in Odela 2, discusses 'milky beauty' tagActor Tamannaah Bhatia will be seen as sadhvi Shiva Shakti in her upcoming Telugu film, Odela 2. She defended director Ashok's choice and said that the 'milky beauty' tag is not something to be ashamed of.

Amitabh Bachchan, Rani Mukerji's Black co-star is now married, see first picsAmitabh Bachchan's Black co-star Ayesha Kapur got married to her longtime boyfriend Adam Oberoi in Delhi on March 23. The first picture of the couple as husband and wife is finally out.

Brad Pitt faces legal hurdle over faulty houses for Hurricane Katrina victimsBrad Pitt is facing a significant legal challenge as a lawsuit filed by Hurricane Katrina victims progresses. The actor's charitable housing project in New Orleans has come under scrutiny.

Actors Nayanthara, Nivin Pauly wrap Dear Students shootActors Nayanthara and Nivin Pauly have completed filming for their upcoming movie, Dear Students. On Sunday, they shared a fun video celebrating the occasion with a party alongside the cast and crew.

BB 18's Mannara Chopra criticises airline for denying boarding, gets trolledActor Mannara Chopra recently slammed an airline for not allowing her to board the flight. The actor shared her ordeal in a video on social media.

KJo calls Adolescence 'blasterclass' for parents, terms the show as forever lessonFilmmaker Karan Johar is the latest celebrity to share his review on Netflix's Adolescence. The director-producer called it a 'forever lesson' and a 'loud wake up call to parents'.

Viral: David Warner brings 'Pushpa' magic to Telugu debut film eventCricketer David Warner recreated the steps of the song 'Srivalli' from Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa: The Rise' at the event of his Telugu debut film, Robinhood. The cricketer will play a cameo in the film.

Anirudh Ravichander's roaring Hukum show sets Chepauk ablaze before CSK vs MISinger and composer Anirudh Ravichander set Chepauk Stadium ablaze with his electrifying 'Badass' performance on Sunday. He energised the crowd with his act ahead of the CSK vs MI match, creating an electrifying atmosphere.

Rashmika on working with Salman Khan in Sikandar: What could be bigger than thatActor Rashmika Mandanna is thrilled as she prepares for the grand release of Sikandar, where she stars alongside Salman Khan. Set to hit theatres on March 30, the film marks their first collaboration.

Salman Khan on 31-year age-gap with Rashmika: Will even work with her daughterSalman Khan addressed trolls over his tired look and age-gap criticism, saying he'll work with his heroines' daughters too. He also joked about proving to social media that he's still around.

Salman Khan on working with Rashmika in Sikandar: She reminds me of my younger selfAt the Sikandar trailer launch event on Sunday, Salman Khan reminisced about working with his co-star Rashmika Mandanna. She also taught the superstar how to make her signature Korean finger heart gesture.

Abhay Deol says cousins Sunny, Bobby stayed away from him as he was annoyingAbhay Deol, part of a renowned Bollywood dynasty, opened up about a childhood shielded from glamour. Despite being the youngest, he shared experiences of being babied yet left out in a joint family setting.

Sikandar trailer: Salman Khan's Eid release packs punches, romance and dramaSalman Khan's Sikandar trailer promises high-octane action, dialoguebaazi and drama. Directed by AR Murugadoss, the Eid release also stars Rashmika Mandanna and Sathyaraj.

Avneet Kaur says 'was touched inappropriately at 8, verbally abused by director'Avneet Kaur recalled being inappropriately touched at 8 and verbally abused by a director at 12. She also addressed filler rumours.

Hrithik Roshan is his girlfriend Saba Azad's biggest cheerleader. Here's proofSaba Azad dazzled in a glamorous outfit with her boyfriend Hrithik Roshan expressing his admiration. The 'Greek God' showered love on the post, calling her 'beautiful'.

Taylor Swift 'loves' best friend Selena Gomez's new album with fiance Benny BlancoSelena Gomez and Benny Blanco's new album, I Said I Love You First, has been receiving widespread acclaim. The singer-actor's best friend, Taylor Swift, also joined in, giving a special shout-out on Instagram.

Yash crashes Honey Singh's Bengaluru concert, agrees for collab on one conditionKGF star Yash surprised fans at Honey Singh's Bengaluru concert. The actor praised Singh and teased a collaboration only if Singh sings in Kannada. The rapper is currently on the Millionaire India Tour and will next perform in Chandigarh.

general news.headline: Mumbai's Habitat Studio shuts down temporarily amid Kunal Kamra joke rowHabitat Studio is the venue in Mumbai where stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra performed. It announced in an Instagram post about shutting down temporarily after Sena workers attacked the place amid a controversy over Kamra's joke on Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde.

Meerut woman forged prescription to buy anxiety drugs days before killing husbandUttar Pradesh officials raided a medical shop in Meerut, where Muskan Rastogi allegedly purchased antidepressants days before drugging and killing her husband.

Video: Kunal Kamra mocks Eknath Shinde, chaos erupts as Sena workers ransack venueKamra, known for his witty remarks and sharp commentary, is now embroiled in controversy over a video from one of his shows, which he shared on his X account.

Tech entrepreneur alleges harassment by wife, Chennai cops over child custodyThe founder of the software company Rippling and tech entrepreneur Prasanna Sankar made serious allegations against his estranged wife, amid their divorce and custody battle. While he claimed harassment by the police, the wife accused him of financial and sexual misconduct.
Can Aaryan Shukla's maths technique make your child a prodigy?Aaryan Shukla's mental maths skills stunned one and all, including Anand Mahindra. Can the technique turn your child into a prodigy too?

Canada PM calls snap polls on April 28 to counter 'unjustified' Trump tariffsWith the threat of Donald Trump's additional tariff threat on Canada, Prime Minister Mark Carney announced a snap election for April 28, seeking to secure a huge mandate to take on the US President's trade war.

Rishabh Pant meets familiar foes as injury-hit Lucknow face DelhiIPL 2025, Delhi Capitals vs Lucknow Super Giants Match Preview: Rishabh Pant's LSG have their task cut out as they face DC in Vizag on Monday, March 24.

Should housing societies have right to ban certain types of food? What India thinksIndia Today's inaugural Gross Domestic Behaviour (GDB) survey found 54 per cent of the respondents supported prohibition on certain types of food by housing societies.

Russia's drone attacks kill 7 in Ukraine as truce talks underway in Saudi ArabiaThe attacks, including on the capital, Kyiv, came ahead of ceasefire negotiations in Saudi Arabia in which Ukraine and Russia are expected to hold indirect US-mediated talks today.

South Korean court overturns PM's impeachment, reinstates him as Acting PresidentHan, South Korea's No 2 official, became acting leader after President Yoon Suk Yeol was impeached by the opposition-controlled National Assembly over his December 3 imposition of martial law that triggered a massive political crisis.

Ground report: Two years on, Manipur is more divided than everThe division has extended to such an extent that not just the people, but even security forces and bureaucrats are facing it. India Today TV recently visited the state, including Churachandpur - epicentre of conflict between the Kukis and Meiteis - to understand the status as the violence nears two years.

Watch: MS Dhoni playfully hits Deepak Chahar with bat in post-match banterIPL 2025, CSK vs MI: MS Dhoni was in the mood to have some fun as he playfully hit Deepak Chahar with his bat after Chennai Super Kings defeated Mumbai Indians by 4 wickets on Sunday, March 23.

Tiger Woods reveals he is dating Donald Trump's ex-daughter-in-lawTiger Woods, the 82-time TOUR winner, confirmed his relationship with Donald Trump's ex-daughter-in-law Vanessa Trump after posting a couple of pictures on his social media account.

Arvind Kejriwal calls BJP 'worse than British', vows AAP's Delhi returnArvind Kejriwal was speaking at the AAP's 'Ek Shaam Shaheedon Ke Naam' event, his first public appearance in Delhi after losing the assembly polls in the national capital.

UP man kills father, slits his throat for having illicit relations with his wifeA man in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat was arrested for allegedly killing his father with a shovel and dumping his body in a forest, police said on Sunday. The accused, Vedpal, claimed he murdered his father, Ishwar, over a domestic dispute, alleging Ishwar had illicit relations with his wife.

How kidney health is interlinked with hydration: Seven myths debunkedStaying well hydrated is critical for keeping this critical organ in good shape and preventing stones, but how much water is too much?

BJP issues notice to party MLA for remarks against Ujjain land acquisitionThe BJP MLA from Alok, Chintamani Malviya had voiced opposition to the permanent acquisition of land in the Ujjain Simhastha area. The party said that his comments harmed the image of the government and party.

Delhi Assembly to elect key panel to examine CAG reports on AAP governmentFollowing the formation of the Public Accounts Committee (PAC), the panel may summon AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal and others in connection with allegations of financial misappropriation raised in the CAG report.

sports.headline: DC vs LSG, pitch, weather report IPL 2025: Will rain affect Vizag clash?Delhi Capitals and Lucknow Super Giants are all set to square off in an intense North Indian derby in Vizag. How will the pitch and weather behave on Monday, March 24.

Novak Djokovic scripts history, Mirra Andreeva's fairytale run endsMiami Open 2025: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic beat Camilo Ugo Carabelli to break Rafael Nadal's record for most matches won in ATP 1000 Masters events.  Mirra Andreeva lost to Amanda Anisimova while Alexandra Eala beat Madison Keys.

Why Rohit Sharma's Champions Trophy method should take a backseat in IPL 2025Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma was dismissed for a four-ball duck in the opening game of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Chennai Super Kings (CSK). After the game, former cricketers Krishnamachari Srikkanth and Shane Watson had some suggestions for Rohit on his approach in recent times.

Dhoni on IPL wicketkeeping heroics: I look like a rice sack falling from truckMS Dhoni played down his wicketkeeping heroics in recent times, saying that his focus is to remain a safe person behind the stumps. Dhoni continues to show incredible skills behind the stumps despite being 43.

Hard to ignore the excitement: Rachin Ravindra on batting with DhoniIPL 2025, CSK vs MI: Rachin Ravindra was amazed by the fan-following for MS Dhoni when the Chepauk crowd erupted after the Chennai Super Kings veteran went out to bat against Mumbai Indians.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
